summary: The Department of Veterans Affairs intends the Medical Surgical Prime Vendor program to be the primary supply source for its 170 medical centers. But only 11% of centers met the VA's target for using the program. The VA plans to revamp the program to fix some problems—like delivery delays and limited supply selection—but that has been delayed. The VA is piloting a similar DOD medical...
title: VA Acquisition Management: Actions Needed to Improve Management of Medical-Surgical Prime Vendor Program and Inform Future Decisions
